A high number of delete vectors indicates the cluster is in a troubled state. 

deleted_row_count > total_row_count*0.05
panels.title: Storage Containers - Delete Vector Count

panels.description:
Monitor the Number of ROS Containers Vertica has an upper threshold of 1024 ROS containers per projection. If the number of ROS containers in your database grows too large, it can negatively affect performance. 

A high number (over 500) of ROS containers indicates a problem with the PARTITION BY clauses of your tables. It can also indicate that the merging process is not functioning. For more information, see Vertica Partitions: The FAQs in the Vertica Knowledge Base.
panels.title: Storage Containers - ROS Count
